Temui Teten, Bos Tokopedia Curhat soal Ekspor hingga Izin UMKM
04 Nov 2019, 08:04 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Manajemen perusahaan e-commerce Tokopedia menyampaikan sejumlah masalah yang dihadapi usaha mikro, kecil, dan menengah atau UMKM saat mengadakan pertemuan dengan Menteri Koperasi dan UMKM Teten Masduki pada hari ini.
CEO Tokopedia William Tanuwijaya mengatakan salah satu perkara yang disampaikan berkaitan dengan keseimbangan ekspor dan impor UMKM. "UMKM kita sekarang tidak punya daya saing. Sampai di luar negeri juga tidak mungkin mereka bisa punya pasar yang jelas," ujar William saat ditemui di kantor Kementerian Koperasi dan UMKM, Senin siang, 4 November 2019.
Menurut William, untuk meningkatkan ekspor produk UMKM, pemerintah dan stakeholder mesti mendukung usaha masyarakat kecil dengan meningkatkan kualitas. Salah satu caranya dengan menggiatkan pelatihan bagi pelaku-pelaku UMKM.
Selain itu, UMKM perlu menguatkan produknya di dalam negeri. Sebab, berkaca dari merek-merek besar di dunia, William menyebut pengusaha yang berhasil di kancah internasional mayoritas memulai bisnis dari level UMKM lebih dulu. Baru setelahnya, mereka mampu memproduksi barang dalam skala besar atau menjadi industri.
Tak hanya soal ekspor dan impor, William menjelaskan masalah yang dihadapi UMKM ialah hilirisasi hingga perizinan. "Banyak sekali UMKM kita yang membuat produksi sendiri, tapi ketika mereka mau membuat produk tersebut berkala nasional, mereka terganjal izin," ujarnya.
Ia menyatakan UMKM acap menunggu lama untuk mengantongi izin produksi. William menyebut, seusai bertemu Teten, entitasnya bersama Kementerian Koperasi dan UMKM akan menyepakati kerja sama.
Namun, William belum menjelaskan detail kesepakatan yang akan diteken kedua pihak ke depan. "Ini baru meeting pertama, kita membahas ruang-ruang apa dan ancaman-ancaman apa yang secara garis besar dihadapi pemain UMKM di Indonesia."
William memungkinkan, kerja sama Tokopedia dan pemerintah akan melingkupi penguatan sektor digital. Misalnya, adanya perizinan satu pintu via online bagi pelaku UMKM.

Meet Teten, Tokopedia Boss Confides in exports to MSME Permit
Nov. 04, 2019, 8:04 by Francisca Christy Rosana, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Management of the e-commerce company Tokopedia conveyed a number of problems faced by micro, small and medium enterprises or MSMEs when holding a meeting with the Minister of Cooperatives and SMEs Teten Masduki today.
Tokopedia CEO William Tanuwijaya said one of the cases submitted was related to the balance of MSME exports and imports. "Our MSMEs now have no competitiveness. Until abroad, it is also impossible for them to have a clear market," William said when met at the Office of the Ministry of Cooperatives and SMEs, Monday afternoon, November 4, 2019.
According to William, to increase the export of MSME products, the government and stakeholders must support the efforts of small communities by improving quality. One way is to intensify training for SMEs.
In addition, MSMEs need to strengthen their products domestically. Because, looking in the mirror of the big brands in the world, William said that the entrepreneurs who succeeded in the international arena the majority started their business from the level of MSME first. Only after that, they are able to produce goods on a large scale or become an industry.
Not only about exports and imports, William explained that the problems faced by MSMEs were downstreaming to licensing. "Many of our MSMEs make their own production, but when they want to make these products nationally, they are hampered by permits," he said.
He said MSMEs often waited a long time to obtain a production permit. William said, after meeting Teten, his entity together with the Ministry of Cooperatives and UMKM would agree on cooperation.
However, William has not explained the details of the agreement to be signed by the two parties going forward. "This is only the first meeting, we discuss what spaces and threats that are generally faced by MSME players in Indonesia."
William made it possible, cooperation between Tokopedia and the government would include strengthening the digital sector. For example, there is a one-door licensing via online for SMEs.
